snippet: Voters will decide in a nationwide referendum whether to uphold the impeachment, amid criticism of moves by the prime minister to consolidate his rule.
abstract: Romanian Parliament votes to impeach Pres Traian Basescu amid rising international criticism of the government's apparent attempts to usurp power and subvert the country's young democracy; Prime Min VIctor Ponta and his left-leaning Social Liberal Union contend that Basescu has violated the Constitution and accuse him of acting as a dictator; Romanian voters will now decide in a nationwide referendum whether to uphold the impeachment.

byline.contributor: Mihai Radu contributed reporting from Bucharest, Romania.

lead_paragraph: Voters will decide in a nationwide referendum whether to uphold the impeachment, amid criticism of moves by the prime minister to consolidate his rule.

headline.seo: Romania Parliament Votes to Impeach Traian Basescu
headline.main: Vote to Impeach President Adds to Turmoil in Romania
headline.print_headline: Vote to Impeach President Adds to Turmoil in Romania
